identificationModule.briefTitle: Empowering Hispanic Patients' Lung Cancer Screening Uptake (Empower Latinx)
identificationModule.officialTitle: Empowering Hispanic Patients' Lung Cancer Screening Uptake (Empower Latinx)

armGroups.label: Arm B: Empower Latinx
interventionNames: Behavioral: Referral to financial navigation resources

interventions.name: Usual Care
interventions.description: The usual care includes a provider flag in electronic medical record (EMR) on patients' eligibility for LCS if their smoking history is complete.

interventions.name: Brief Patient Education
interventions.description: Brief one-page education material on lung cancer screening benefits and risk

interventions.name: Patient education
interventions.description: Patients will be sent information (in preferred language) on lung cancer risk, lung cancer screening (LCS) benefits, harms, false positive rates, recommendations of follow-up for positive results, and exam insurance coverage.

interventions.name: Referral to financial navigation resources
interventions.description: Patients who self-report needing help with health-related social risks at baseline will be sent a brochure (in preferred language) from patient advocate foundation (PAF), a national non-profit financial navigation organization, where patients can self-refer.

interventions.name: Patient Reminders
interventions.description: within 2 weeks prior to appointment, patients will receive a text message or a phone call (if not having a phone that receives text messaging) encouraging patients to discuss lung cancer screening with their provider.

interventions.name: Provider Reminders
interventions.description: Within 2 weeks prior to primary care appointment, providers will be notified of their patient's eligibility for lung cancer screening and their reported barriers.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Number of participants with order of Low-dose CT (LDCT) for lung cancer screening (LCS)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Number of Participants who received LDCT for LCS
Number of Participants with the documented discussion of lung cancer screening with their providers in the electronic medical record
Patients' perceived risk of lung cancer
secondaryOutcomes.description: 3-item perceived risk of lung cancer questionnaire developed by Carter Harris et al (Cancer Nurs, 2018) will be used. The responses for each item will be based on a 5-point likert scale. A sum score will be calculated based on responses to all 3 item. Score will range between 3 and 15. Higher score= higher perceived risk.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Patients' perceived severity of lung cancer
secondaryOutcomes.description: 5-items about the health consequences and severity of lung cancer will be used. The responses for each item will be based on a 5-point likert scale. A sum score will be calculated based on responses to all items. Score will range between 5-25. Higher score= higher perceived benefits.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Patients' perceived benefits of lung cancer screening
secondaryOutcomes.description: 6-item perceived benefit of lung cancer questionnaire developed by Carter Harris et al (Cancer Nurs, 2018) will be used. The responses for each item will be based on a 5-point likert scale. A sum score will be calculated based on responses to all items. Score will range between 6-30. Higher score= higher perceived benefits.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Patients' perceived barriers of lung cancer screening
secondaryOutcomes.description: 19-item perceived barriers of lung cancer questionnaire will be used. 17 of these items were developed by Carter Harris et al (Cancer Nurs, 2018). The responses for each item will be based on a 5-point likert scale. A sum score will be calculated based on responses to all 17 validated items. Score will range between 17 and 85. Higher score= higher perceived barriers. An additional score including all 19 items will also be calculated.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Patients' self-efficacy of lung cancer screening
secondaryOutcomes.description: 10-item self-efficacy for lung cancer screening questionnaire will be used. 9 of these items were developed by Carter Harris et al (Cancer Nurs, 2018). The responses for each item will be based on a 5-point likert scale. A sum score will be calculated based on responses to all 9 validated item. Score will range between 9 and 45. Higher score= higher self-efficacy. An additional score including all 10 items will also be calculated.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Patients' knowledge about lung cancer screening
secondaryOutcomes.description: 9 questions adopted and modified from Volk R et al (PMID: 24518006) will be used. Responses will be based on true, false, unsure. Sum of correctly responded questions will be calculated. Higher score= higher knowledge.

otherOutcomes.description: Patient experience with intervention components will be assessed through qualitative interview of a subset of patients in Arm B (Empower Latinx). The results will be qualitatively described.
otherOutcomes.timeFrame: Within 6 months after completion of the follow-ups

otherOutcomes.description: Provider experience with intervention components will be assessed through qualitative interview of a subset of providers taking care of patients in Arm B (Empower Latinx). The results will be qualitatively described.
otherOutcomes.timeFrame: Within 3 months after last patient completion of follow-up

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Aged 50- 80 years of age.
* Be able to speak English and Spanish
* Must have a scheduled appointment with their Primary Care Providers within next one to three months.
* The Scheduled PCP appointment is at any of the 4 University of California Irvine Health (UCI Health) primary care clinics in Orange County including two UCI federally qualified health centers
* History of 20-pack year smoking history ( based on survey self-report)
* Current smoker or a former smoker who has quit smoking within the last 15 years (based on survey self-report)

Exclusion Criteria:

* Prior history of lung cancer
* Chest CT for any reason in the last 12 months based on self-report and UCI EMR
* History of Alzheimer\&#39;s disease or dementia

locations.facility: UCI Health Family Health Center - Anaheim
UCI Health Family Health Center - Santa Ana
